Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Lauren B
Reviews.Content: We walked into the room and almost cried.The whole place is filthy. The only good thing is its a block from the beach but we literally had to by Raid and Lysol and spray EVERYTHING just to feel comfortable enough to sit in the chairs and lay in the beds. There were flies everywhere and apparently a leak in our ceiling was repaired with a paper towel before our stay. It still leaked. And I'm pretty sure this place doesn't have a maid. We were informed that we must take out our own trash or be charged $20... our room had a small filthy kitchen area with a moldy fridge with a sign that said the maid doesn't do the kitchen, so clean it yourself. Nothing looked smelled or felt like it had been cleaned in years. Had to get drunk just to be delirious enough to sleep on the bed. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Run Far Far Away!”
Reviews.Author: Jaimet49
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. We were in room 27 and literally packed up out stuff and paid for another room at a different hotel because God knows they won't give you your money back. We have hives on our legs and found dried vomit or fecal matter all over the inside of the bathroom door. If you stay take a couple cans of Clorox wipes. You will need every single one of them. We saw the linens they were getting ready to put in people's beds sitting on the very dirty balcony. All I can say is I felt cleaner not taking a shower than taking one there. Rooms are very small and dark. A lot like being in a cave. I can't think of nice thing to say about The Islander Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kjill99
Reviews.Content: If they fixed this place up it would be nice. Great location on 20th street across from Phillips. One block walk to the ocean. --the Pool area-- Dirty fountain in the pool area. Lovely shade of light brown water. Broken lounge chairs in the pool area. Right where your butt would sit, there are not slats on the chairs. Dead plants in the pool area. Large and clean pool. The tables and chairs are a mismatch, umbrellas are somewhat tattered. Empty planters are used as ashtrays. Smoker friendly. --perimeter of the hotel-- Needs sweeping. Trash, debris, cigarette butts, etc...general litter. --The motel itself, the room-- First thing I noticed was the wood on the door near the locks, it appeared as if it had been broken into by the cops or someone wanted in real bad. Chunks of wood missing. The room was cool, functional AC. I saw no bugs. Maid service was a joke. Towels scarce, bring your own. The linens were dated and the maid doesn't make beds well. No fitted sheets and she doesn't know how to do hospital corners. Prepare to remake your bed. No carpet, just bare floor tile and that's ok if it was clean. Wear your flip flops while walking. There was a stove in our room. Electric and rusty on the top. Inside the cabinets were pots and pans, but the cabinets were filthy, so wash the pots and pans WELL before you use them. Best if you don't attempt it. Wood paneling on the walls circa 1970. Mismatched light fixtures. Broken lampshades. Poor choice of tv channels. Remote didn't work and had no back over the batteries. We found the remote on day 2 under the bed. Under the bed...belongings that didn't belong to us. The maid doesn't clean under the bed. Table and 4 mismatched chairs of various shapes and sizes. NO WATER PRESSURE to speak of for a shower. Dated and difficult to use faucets, especially graduating between hot and cold. Windows could use a good washing. Marked and spotty. Bathroom could use a really good scrubbing. The entire room could have benefitted from a bleach bath. Drawers in the dresser were broken and fell off the track. Just leave your things in a bag please. No hospitality at all whatsoever. No wifi signal to speak of even though it is clearly stated 'free wifi'. The best part about this motel was the pier and the docks, which you can go crabbing or fishing off of. The kids loved that and feeding the ducks that swam in there. I'd recommend this if you are spending 99% of your time OUT of the room or if you are on a NONEXISTANT budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price & You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey M
Reviews.Content: While this motel is certainly a deal and sometimes you get what you pay for, I have to say that I was a little disappointed with this motel and would not recommend it to anyone. While the room was fairly clean, there were a few things that I would recommend they fix. There were very few outlets in this room. We had to decide between watching TV and having a light on. I also had to dry my hair in the kitchen area. Our toilet was very wobbly so it was difficult to sit on (especially my young children), the tub did not have a stopper so my 5 year old had to take a shower (which she hates!), the shower did not have a shower head, just a pipe coming out of the wall with very low water pressure to get the sand off. I would recommend you bring your own towels since they only give you tiny ones that barely cover a body. The dead bolt on the door did not work and the door barely fits into the jam so everyone would slam their doors to get them closed. The pool was in very bad condition, broken tiles, non working fountain, etc. This motel is also on the bay side so you do have to walk across Coastal Highway to get to the beach. If you have small children, be aware of this. Wouldn't recommend to anyone except maybe a college student who wants a cheap vacation and doesn't care much about location.

Reviews.Title: “No way never ever ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: baseballbat
Reviews.Content: ,We stayed at oc islander from Friday /Sunday omg the rooms r so small ,smells of wildew,AC loud and old,walls have splashes of some kinda liquids on them,door knobs sticky,light switches are so dirty I didnt even touch them,TV old, remote control didn't even work ! We couldn't even look out the window and enjoy the view because windows are sooooo dirty and outdated,pool is gross and trash was all over the place,its just a run down motel with employees who dont care about quality care or the health of others, house keepers dont clean good,bed sheets are nasty,toilets dirty,showers (we were to scared to get in shower) towels had brown stains on all of them ,they only give u two towels, dusty,carpets wett and smell,I felt like I couldn't breath in r room,,,please dont stay at the islander its a waste of time and 400.00,spend alittle more $ and be safe at a clean hotel and enjoy your vacation,I regret letting my fiancé pick our hotel,he was very upset and disappointed as well..if u have kids please dont stay here...I think im going to call health department on this hotel

Reviews.Title: “ONLY STAY HERE IF YOU ARENT IN YOUR ROOMS AND YOUR OUT AND ABOUT”
Reviews.Author: debra d
Reviews.Content: PLEASE, by all means CHECK OUT YOUR ROOM FIRST BEFORE YOU PAY, all rooms are musty and mildewed no coffee,or ice , BAD, BAD i called health dept, and wanted to know how can they rent rooms like this,we bought 3 cans of llysol to kill the odor ,and the mattress you sleep on is a piece of rotten foam 2inches,no fitted sheets, only straight ones as soon as you move your on plastic,,,

Reviews.Title: “one of the worse experience. run away from this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationbum509
Reviews.Content: My wife, pre-teen son and I stayed at this deplorable motel. The lady behind the desk in the office was rude. There were only two towels in the bathroom and my wife had to use the towel she used after showering as a floor mat. I went to ask for additional towels and the mean lady said that towels will be available next morning. We had wet used towels outside on the corner of our room and the entrance rug to our room was wrapped in a ball and soaked and dirty. The sink backed up when people in the room above us used water. GROSS!!! and it was a challenge to flush the toilet!!! Took this motel off my favorites!!! Too bad I did not read the reviews before I finalize my reservations. Only good thing about the place is the marina behind the motel. Actually, a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “yuck”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie T
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I were just in OC last week. We booked this place because of the price and the fact that they had an outdoor pool. We check in, and the lady behind the desk was very unpleasant. As soon as we opened the room, this HORRIBLE odor of mold/mildew hits you! There were flies in our room. Also after being in there for 5 mins, our toilet started to overflow. I went to the office to complain and the same nasty lady behind the counter hands ME a plunger! Im sorry, did I not just hand you 500 dollars? Thats YOUR Job!!! Our towels and swimsuits never dried because of how damp the room was. Walls and ceiling were paper thin. Tiny TV. The carpets were filthy. The mattress was thin. You never knew if the shower was going to be hot or cold. There were NO outlets to plug in phone chargers, etc. And to top it off, I now have some sort of rash on my back. When people say you get what you paid for? NO...I got way LESS than that! DO NOT GO TO THIS Motel. Never AGAIN! I will spend the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Bang for the Buck"!”
Reviews.Author: Ann M
Reviews.Content: For the price of the Hotel compared to other O.C. Hotels it's a steal! I almost feel guilty for paying the amount I did ! The room was great and looked recently re-done and the maids kept it super clean and re-stocked with towels, soap and bathroom tissue. the pool was awesome and I enjoyed relaxing in the sun there! The hotel conveinately located near a bus stop so if you like to have a couple of drinks on vacation like I do, you can ride the bus to anything you desire without worry of a DUI . The staff was very friendly and helpful and no matter what time of day or night it was , you found someone keeping the grounds clean. There were soda and water machines at the hotel but I would recommend bringing cases of your own. For breakfast and lunch I would recommend the Brass Balls on the boardwalk between 10th and 12th st's . Or for convenance Dunkin Donuts is across the street and Mc Donalds is 2 blocks North . For the best Rib's in the world try Nick's on about 145th street .for the best crab cakes try Captain's Galley 2 , take route 50 west then left on Golf Course Road. I had a great time at The Islander and will stay there every time I visit O.C.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Islander”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and recently remodeled, the air conditioner worked well . The staff was very friendly and efficient and catered to all our needs , towels , taking garbage cleaning the room and they kept the grounds Immaculate ! Plus the Islander is very close to food : the popular Phillips Sea Food Restaurant is right across the street . A McDonalds is very close along with a CVS. Across the Street their is a beer and wine store , a Dunkin Donuts and a Pizza Place. The infamous party block is a close walk and for the more mature partiers there is Fish Tails which is behind the hotel on the bay side . The pool at the Islander is very clean and well maintained . The Ocean and the boardwalk are a short stroll from the hotel also . I really enjoyed my stay at the Islander and can't wait to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not SUITABLE for ANYONE”
Reviews.Author: Lucy C
Reviews.Content: When checking in, the front desk lady was rude. Our room smelled as if it were clean, but it was not. Bathroom curtain ripped, the floors/carpet were dirty (you can see the black on our socks). The AC was working, but the vents were EXTREMELY filthy. I purchased cleaning products from CVS and cleaned it myself. I could not afford to look else where, so I cleaned the entire room/bathroom for myself and my 3 young children. The WiFi sucked or none(need to be near office), no telephone in room, no icemakers around, and very few TV channels worked. Will NEVER, EVER stay here and definitly NOT RECOMMEND this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Go some where else”
Reviews.Author: NatyMR
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel a few times in the past,12 years later and the rooms look the same, no improvements or renovations at all. The only good thing is the pool and its withing walking distance to the beach and some eaterys, otherwise even the pool lounge chairs are falling apart. The beds are thin and shabby (good thing we had our air matress in the trunk- put it on the bed), the rooms are musty, the kitchenettes are rusty and old. For $199 a night they should at least renovate a little,

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...terrible”
Reviews.Author: Rafael G
Reviews.Content: Terrible place to stay. Rooms are extremily dirty and stinky. Rooms have a lot of ants. No towels inside the roons No WiFi in the rooms...at the front desk,they told me that the only place is around the office...don't make a sence. At every "place" I stayed, the late check out is at 12pm and free...they told me that late check out is $35 extra, not kidding. Refrigirator barely working. Dirty carpets Front desk service are terrible and not help with any concern. The spa next to the pool...not working. Batteries for remote controls...not working. Electric stove...barely working. Terrible place...terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad, but I've had worse...”
Reviews.Author: Dave T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 9 year old granddaughter to Ocean City for the July 4th week and tried to find an inexpensive motel to stay in. There's a good reason this hotel has low prices. I read the other reviews and yes, the rooms are not clean. There were some unidentifiable purple stains on the shower surround and the molding (really) along the floor in the bathroom was mildewed. The air conditioner had a puddle under it on the floor inside the room. After asking where the ice machine was (the guy behind the office counter said "I dunno"), we found it alongside the building and in pieces. We had to buy ice down the block for the whole week. I was pleasantly surprised to actually find a working refrigerator in the room. The Direct TV fritzed out on and off for the whole week. The wi-fi signal was also pretty weak and we were told that the best place to use it was in the office. (lol) The "spa" next to the pool looks as though it hasn't working in quite some time and there were beer cans sitting on the wall along side it that were there for the whole week. Fresh towels were handed to us at our door every day, although we opted out of having anyone service our room at cleaning time. Gotta say, this is not the worst room we've stayed in. It was bad, but not the worst. If you really need a place to stay and are severely budget minded and don't mind quite a few compromises, this could be the place for you. The "cheese factor" alone made this a memorable stay. I wouldn't stay here again, but we survived and no one got sick or anything. The only thing that really made us unhappy about our stay was the family staying in the room directly over us. These animals must've been raised by wolves and this had to be their first foray into civilization. We could hear voices of children between the screams of their parents to "shut up!!". The kids sounded under 10 years old. This family would come back to their room somewhere from 11:30 pm to 5 am, and immediately start running across the floor, jump up and down and yell at each other. In all my years, this family was the worst neighbors I have ever had at anyplace I've ever stayed. Room 82, you know who you are.

Reviews.Title: “Its 2:47AM&the noise outside is crazy!”
Reviews.Author: kimnpgh
Reviews.Content: ...we're not even on the boardwalk! The ppl r loud, the music is loud,& the a/c is loud. Mold&ants n bathroom. I wouldn't recomend for families except n off season maybe. Perfect for young adults who are up partying anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Worst nightmare ever”
Reviews.Author: Chris E
Reviews.Content: Islander Motel is the dirtiest Motel I have ever stayed at. They don t clean your room. Mold on Picture frames, soda on walls, No towels, No toilet paper, room service is only available once every four days There are rust stains in sink, Dirt on shower curtains, Holes in floor along baseboards Showing you room below. When you reserve a room and show up at 11 O clock at night your room beds will be made, but there is beer bottles in trash cans, Beer caps on stove, and floors covered with debris. When you complain, your room is downsized to something worse and have to fight for difference in room cost. Owner and or Manager hides from complaints and will not return calls, emails, or won t be present when you go to motel office. From thursday to monday morning my room was only cleaned once. Door to room didn t lock, Floors left my feet darker than fresh Black payment. Took cover off bed and found big stain on sheet (red). When I complain, Came back to room, staff was so nice to leave sheet on my bed to change myself. No internet in room, Tv remote doesn t work with TV, Glass under bed and on floor from broken picture frame, Doors didn t latch because latch was on window sill bathing in the sun. After Non stop fighting motel gives me another room. After moving to new room I am told I must pay more for there bad service or return to my old room. I refused and was force to go back to my horrible old room. Minors drinking outside everywhere and smoking wacky tobacco. If you look from the parking lot into any room good chance you will see an orgy or naked body being displayed through someone s motel window. This is not conclusive....

Reviews.Title: “worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the islander for cruise week 2012 and it was the worst place i have ever stayed at in my entire life! the rooms are expensive for what you get every thing is out of date and we had a few friends over being 100% quite just watching tv the man that runs the place barges in our room and screams at everyone with out knocking and tells them to leave and no one is allowed to visit! then looks at me and yells at me telling me there are cameras on the property and will fine me extra for each person found hanging out that isnt spending the night there. also people partying in the parking lot all night did not have a thing said to them for taking other tendents chairs including ours please do not waste your money you will not enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “Staff People suck! BEWARE & STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: kdash10
Reviews.Content: I strongly suggest never going here! The place is extremely outdated and dirty our toilet didnt even flush. We went on off season, virtually no one was staying there only the 4 people I had book the room with. I had a couple friends come visit for about 20 mins and we were evicted. I had to pay $110 for the eviction. I will let you know we got evicted the first 30 mins of beginning there around 6pm, my friends we're not being crazy and we hadn't even started drinking yet. I got completely ripped off and I want to make it my goal to make sure no one ever has to experience the rudeness I had to go through. This place is HELL. Luckily we found a much better place, cheaper and extremely friendly staff, the Executive Hotel on 30th is very nice and well priced. They did not kick us out and we actually were loud at that place at the end of the nite but bc no one was really there, the staff didnt care as long as we stayed inside and didnt ruin anything. This place was Golden.

Reviews.Title: “No need to return”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Vanillathunder
Reviews.Content: My fiancee & I stayed there for one night, spring 2012. We were going to a wedding in OC and wanted a cheap place to stay. Well, we got exactly what we paid for: cheap. As my fiancee said, you can be a cheap hotel and put forth an effort, or you can just be a cheap hotel. This one was the latter. No proper shower head in the shower; no 50-cent shampoo/conditioner sampler bottles; 2 miniscule bath towels for 2 people; "seating" at the table in the room consisted of 2 indoor/outdoor plastic greebn flimsy chairs; "view" was overlooking the pool (which had about 9 inches of green water in it and a few potted plants that had either blown into the pool or thrown in by someone-and never removed). Positives about the Islander: location (20th street), the king-size bed (comfortable), and the curtains did a good job blocking out the light. However, the Islander is right on Coastal Hwy-and you can hear all the street traffic. If you're a light sleeper, take some earplugs. You can also hear your neighbors, as the wood paneled walls were very unsuccessful in blocking noise. This reminds me of a hotel for senior week-ers, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “June 2011 <3”
Reviews.Author: EJK39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Islander this summer. I would recommend this motel to anyone looking for a cheap place to stay. It was exactly what we needed, the service was fantastic. The owner (Theo) came to know us quite well and if we needed ANYTHING he was on it right away. Be it an extra pillow, towels, or toilet paper. The staff was more than kind and stopped whenever we saw them even just to chat. The location is prime and is in close enough proximity to the beach and town. I know that I will be booking my room here from here on out for my trips to O.C. And to top it all off I met my now fiance here, so YES this place will always hold a place in my heart.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, awesome service”
Reviews.Author: DarlaQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (along with our 2 young daughters) stayed at the Islander in August. We were a little hesitant about going at first because of some of the reviews we read here. However, looking back on it we are so glad that we stayed and this will be our permanent place every time we go back to Ocean City. The Islander is family owned and I'm pretty sure everyone that works in their office is one family. The lady who works there is such a busy bee. Everytime I saw her (when we would be sitting outside our room) she was either working in the office, running to the laundry to work or cleaning a room herself. The motel itself is pretty old and im a realist, I know old buildings develop smells after some time but it was nothing like the way some people here are making it out to be. They try their hardest (I personally witnessed it several times) to please their guests and make their rooms as comfortable as possible but things break down all the time, I understand that so I would never hold them responsible for it - so long as they fixed it or at least attempted. :) Their pool is one of the nicest we have been to in OC. It is not too deep (about 4 feet if I recall correctly) but it is a lot larger than most of the other pools in OC. My daughters had a great time swimming and my husband and I got some much needed sun. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone my only complaint was some of the other guests there were a little obnoxious and got too rowdy but overall I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “not the worst but not the best”
Reviews.Author: alison d
Reviews.Content: ok. we stayed here the first of june with our one year old daughter. we booked it ahead of time and got there early. they wouldnt let us check in till 1pm.. then i had to sign a waiver stating that we wouldnt tear up the place(it was senior week and they thought we were high schoolers). even though all that was a hassle, the hotel room itself wasnt bad.. it was def. older looking but for an overnite trip id book there again. i wouldnt want to stay there a week though.. there were a few bad points, 1.there wasnt an alarm clock..thankfully we had our cell phone on us.. 2.you could hear the outside noise. the walls werent very insulated.and 3 i didnt like being treated like a bad seed when i was trying to have a day away with my husband and daughter..besides that we didnt have a bad time.. i didnt get in the pool so im not sure if it was clean or not...would i book there again???well if i was only going over night w/o my kids..

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: btwagner
Reviews.Content: I never have felt compelled to write a review until I stayed at this dump. The first thing we noticed when we walked in was the smell, terrible. We had reserved a efficiency room so much to our surprise when we found 1 fork, 1 knife, 1 plate, 2 cups and a unplugged refrigerator. The carpet was filthy, there was something black on the ceiling above the door not to mention the room above us, their plumbing was leaking right over one of our beds. You could also hear every footstep in the room above. The bed consisted of a 4" thick foam mattress but unless you wanted to sleep on the filthy carpet thats what you were stuck with. Our toilet leaked in the bathroom which led to the carpet being soaked as it leaked out of the bathroom. Just please do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to stay somewhere else. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “This week will be our 3rd time staying @ The Islander this summer!!”
Reviews.Author: facbilltown79
Reviews.Content: My son & friend suggested we check out The Islander when we visited Ocean City, MD in July 2010. We haven't been to Ocean City MD in 27 years. We found The Islander to be inexpensive, very clean, very close to the Boardwalk & ocean. We especially were very pleased with the service & friendliness of the workers. This week will be our 3rd stay @ The Islander since July!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN OCEAN CITY!”
Reviews.Author: JoeChacon
Reviews.Content: The Islander has a great location to the boardwalk, beachfront, etc. It is owned and managed by a super friendly and charming family. When you stay at the Islander, you feel like you are at home among family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to sleep and shower”
Reviews.Author: jasamjasam
Reviews.Content: The place gets bad reviews but its super cheap. Stayed 4 nights at the end of june and it cost me $70 per night tax included. The room we had wasnt bad. It had 1 double bed, a fridge, table with 2 chairs and a tv. It was pretty clean, not spotless but nothing nasty. The bed itself sucked. The box springs was stained and looked aweful. The mattress was only about 4 inches thick and it was covered by a plastic mattress protecter. The Islander is an ok place to sleep and shower. The nicest part is the pool. It made me mad however that the pool closed at 9pm but that the creepy owner could have private parties in it until midnight. The location is good. 21st and bayside. right next door to fishtales and a few blocks from the salty dog and paddocks. only a 3 minute walk to the beach. We went during a senior week so there were alot of young kids 16-20 years old staying with out supervision. They seemed to be placed in the rear building and all of the families seemed to be in the front building. Overall if your not too picky and need something cheap the islander will work.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: gina1217
Reviews.Content: I have been going to OC for many years, and stayed at many places. This place is by far the worst. When we arrived the owner insisted on walking me to my room and going in with me ( Kinda creepy ), he then plugged in the hot refridgerator. The air conditioner only worked on the 1st night. Hot water was hit or miss. Then the owner harrassed the people staying next to us , about friends visiting and told them that when he turned the outside lights out , they had to leave , or pay to stay there, Which is what the guy did. When they went to the office , the owner proceded to lecture him about it and still made them go inside. The owner is Russian I think and as wierd as acan be. He must have forgotten that we are in America and you shouldn't treat people that way. The best part of the place is the pool, so if we ould have stayed at the pool all of the time, I would have been ok. I will never stay here again, and would never recomment it to anyone, expeciallly younger people....

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT bad”
Reviews.Author: WalterBWI
Reviews.Content: We decided at the last minute to drive to OC and took our chances at finding a hotel. The Islander was the most reasonable for one night. We stayed on the third floor, room 91. Was it the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, of course not. But it was acceptable. The beds were clean and bath. The bath had been newly tiled, but tub/toilet/sink were still old, but okay. I didn't find anything disgusting. Room had a little fridge and also a TV, two chairs and desk. Pool was clean as was the pool area. There was a lot of noise from the street (jerks revving their engines, loud music), but the air conditioner in room drowned most of that out. Room was only 2 blocks from the beach, convenient to just about everything. This motel was not my first choice, but I wasn't going to pay $250-300 for one night in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to be kidding me”
Reviews.Author: mf21hall
Reviews.Content: Stay as far away from this dump as you can. The pool gave me a very bad UTI i was in the hospital 2 days after the stay. My dr told me never to go there again as if I would. The beach was GREAT and the food was out of this world but the hotel SUCKED.

Reviews.Title: “You're better off sleeping in your car!!! This place is a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: imjustanotherday
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled, this place is a dump. We were hit in the face by the foul smell of mold/mildew as soon as we opened the door. The carpet was so FILTHY that we had to go and buy flip flops to wear while we were in the room because our feet turned black!! The shower head only had about 7 holes for the water to flow trough. The guy came and checked it out and said that it was working ok......ok, if your idea of a shower is to slap some vodka under your pits..... which is what he smelled like. We had to use a square ice bucket in the shower so we could wash and rinse our hair. I had to rinse the kids bathing suits out in the fountain outside by the pool, since there was no water pressure in the sink either. If given a choice between staying at this dump or sleeping in my car.....I honestly would prefer to sleep in my car......my car is a whole lot cleaner. Don't let the pictures on the brochure fool you, this place is a first class DUMP!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for everyone, for family in budget or for a weekend in the beach”
Reviews.Author: albabebe39
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay in this motel; I don't understand all the other bad reviews. We stayed for 6 days/nights while on a family vacation in July 09. The room was very clean; the sheets were crisp clean everyday, beds were comfortable and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Complimentary coffee was available all day at the front desk and the room had a small kitchen area (stove, pots & pans, refrigerator, dishes & cups) which makes this a great value for families. Terrific location, easy to be on the boardwalk or beach within minutes. The outdoor pool was great, we would see a staff member staying by the pool all day checking out and making sure everything was perfect, he would even pick up stuff from the ground that kids would drop here and there. Our experience was not the same as everyone else complaining here.

Reviews.Title: “happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: pinkspider92
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Islander. The rooms were very clean and the room service was great they came in everyday and made the room look and feel great. The room included a small kitchen area which saved us money as an alternative for eating our for every meal. The AC worked great and the room was nice and cool the whole time we were there. The owners and staff were very friendly and accomidating. The location of the hotel was great a one minute walk from the beach and boardwalk and other places that were essential to a comfortable stay like convience stores and tourist attractions. I loved my stay here and would not only go back but also recommend it to anyone else. the price was very affordable and the quality of my stay was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs! Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: red235
Reviews.Content: I really don't have anything good to say about & I wish I would have read the reviews before I booked it! My biggest complaint were the bugs in the bathroom & in the tub! The sink in the bathroom was clogged & took a long time for the water to go down...GROSS!! The mattress was not very comfortable & I woke up to an achey back. Oh yeah, I almost fogot..we didn't get room service because they forgot to give us a card to hang on the door knob that requests service. I did go down to the office & explained the situation & after much debate he did say he would bring me some towels. I told him I needed 4. He brought me 4 towels & 2 wash clothes. It was the same wasy when we checked in(only 4 towels,2 wash clothes). The only nice thing I have to say about the place was that the pool was well maintained .

Reviews.Title: “girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: lisacandygirl
Reviews.Content: The place is looking better every year i come there . I love the potted plants around the pool , it makes a big difference ,looks beautiful. The place loook very nice decks are getting painted ,new desk , tabels in rooms . Cant wait to see whats new next time. Thank you for a great stay , Will be back soon L isa

Reviews.Title: “i thought i commited murder”
Reviews.Author: hotlion18a
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i went down to the beach with two other of our close friends looking to have i relaxing vacation, but that was not the case when we stayed her. when we first arrived at the hotel we were treated to an awful odor that we soon discovered was come form the stove. as we got use to the smell we noticed holes all over the wall. the light in the bathroom didn't work the tv didn't have a remote. an the plates and other kitchen supplies that we paid for were nowhere to be found. after we got over all that we started to notice that we were being watched like we were doing something wrong. our friends came up to grab a sweatshirt and were immediately kick out and quickly told not to return.but what we couldn't understand is the young kids to blare music at 8 o'clock in the morning and nothing be done about it. the night guard came up to our room twice once while we were in bed sleeping and insisted to come in so we let him in and he insisted on yelling at us for i guess sleeping to hard.

Reviews.Title: “This dump should be shut down!!!!! Immediately!!!!”
Reviews.Author: colatherealthang
Reviews.Content: My grown children had called me earlier that morning to invite me to a get a way to enjoy on a Saturday night until Sunday afternoon. Since every other Hotel had a 2 night minimum, my husband and I drove around looking for a place to stay overnight. BAD DECISION to Stop Here!!!!!! The Staff started off nice offering us the opportunity to keep our vehicles parked there while we went to the Beach the next day and even offered to let us take a shower when we returned from the Beach (even though we would have checked out by 11 am). Anyway, I did check out the room and notice that there was a FOUL, MUSTY, MILDEWY, MOLDY ODER to the room (even though my nose was stuffy). My daughter, however who also has allergies IMMEDIATELY begin to start sneezing, eyes watering and itching once she entered the room. When I brought this to their attention another room was offered, BUT there was NO Change in the Horrible/Terrible Oder and we asked for a refund. We were told that there was No Refunds and that it was not his problem that my daughter has allergies. We then went to the Super Fresh to get candles and Frebreeze hoping that we could make due, but it did not help at all. At 11:30 p.m. the staff came by the room to advise us that the other family members that were visiting had to leave. (Oh, by the way, I'm 43 years old and my youngest 20) At this point we had had ENOUGH!!!! We returned the key and went to The Admiral were we had other family members staying and got a room there. I would not reccommend this DUMP to anyone and don't understand WHY and HOW are they still in business????? Well, I am definitely working on that!!!

Reviews.Title: “if you have any other option, even at a higher price, stay there!”
Reviews.Author: kat00005
Reviews.Content: I thought when I booked this hotel, I was getting a great deal!!! We were sorely disappointed when we were given a closet of a room. The "large double bed" was the size of a single with a matress about 4 inches thick---it was liking sleeping on a rock. The fire detector wires had been cut---God forbid the hotel caught on fire, we probably wouldn't know about it. Our TV did not have an on or off button---you had to plug it in to "turn it on" and unplug it to "turn it off". There was only one channel. When we complained, the night manager said with a smile "no refunds!" amd instructed us we should have examined the fire detector and the television first. Sorry, I guess we just thought it was the hotel's job to make sure the room was ready for a paying customer....We ended up paying for two nights and only staying for one....Do not stay at the Islander Motel----it is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and owners”
Reviews.Author: Crystal172
Reviews.Content: It was an ok price but they treated us pretty bad. First of all they messed up on our reservations. I called them and fixed it(or so I thought) after not being charged for the room on my credit card for the room(they said they didn't have record of me calling). When we got there they still sent us to the wrong room(wasn't an efficiency which I had paid for). The worse thing was how the man that worked there was like a night-guard. My fiance went up to the room with his friend at 10: 05 to grab a sweatshirt and they yelled at him for bringing someone up to the room(cant do that after 10). The man was always outside watching the whole motel. It was crazy. It wasn't like they were being loud or anything, which I could understand him needed to do something. And it was too early in the night to assume that they were going to bed at that hour.(An extra guest is a little bit more money).... But that really turned me off. The hotel my friend was staying at wasn't like that and I would rather go there next time I travel to OC.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Fatb0yGirl
Reviews.Content: I received great service from the Islander Motel. Unable to arrive the evening of the first night of our reservation, I called the motel to let them know that we would be arriving the next morning. She answered my call and said, "no problem, have a safe trip." I asked if there was a microwave in the room and she said, "no, but just bring me what you want to heat, and I will heat it for you." The room was clean and colorful. No, it is not cutting edge style with high end furniture, but "retro" is fine with me as long as it's clean, and it was. The bathroom was recently tiled, and yes, it had painted plywood at the top portion of the wall, but who cares, it was freshly painted and neatly done. There was no maid service, and you had to get new towels by turning in the used ones at the desk each day. This may bother some people, but not me, as I don't like maids entering my room every day just so they can make my bed and go through my luggage. The A/C worked great, in fact, we had to turn it to low because it worked so well. Fridge worked well too. It was a bummer that the hot tub by the pool wasn't working. Overall, it was a pleasure to stay in Room #90!

Reviews.Title: “taking a break”
Reviews.Author: humpy98
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say we had a great weekend, just moms away taking a break from kids, work , home . Everything was nice pool, rooms, friendly oweners . The only thing i was not happy about was the people above me keeping me up till 3:00 so i went to the owner about this problem , with in second you took care of it. The next night there was no problem Thank You for taking care of it right away . LISA

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pleased_80Pleased_80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a mini-vacation in O.C. and were pleased with the price and convenience the Islander Motel provided. The room was cleanly, the a.c. worked properly and kept the room cool, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was ideal. There wasn't a phone in the room, but who doesn't have a cell on them these days? And there may not have been a microwave, but there are so many restaurants to choose from and close by. The front desk staff was happy to give us more towels when we stopped by the office late one evening. It was quiet at night and many seemed to enjoy the pool during the day. Not to mention the beach and boardwalk are two short blocks away! We greatly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again. If you are considering hotels/motels in the O.C. area and are on a budget, consider the Islander. We figured the less we spent on our lodging, the more we could spend on delicious foods at the neighboring restaurants. Our one critique was that the towels were rough and thin. There will always be poor reviews for hotels, but ours does not fall into that category whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Not Recommend the Islander Motel to Anyone”
Reviews.Author: diappointedinoc
Reviews.Content: Before booking our reservation we called to checkout the amenities after reviewing the Islander's website. We wanted an effeciency. We were assured that the effeciency would come fully equipped with dishes, cookware, towels, etc. We called a few days before checking in to confirm what we could expect and decide what to bring. The person with which we spoke told us that we had a very nice recently remodeled room. When we arrived the room smelled of some chemical, the carpet was stained, the furnishings and decore dated. There were limited items for use in the kitchen (that we were afraid to use), there were a few towels in the bathroom, but no washclothes, no bath mat for the floor, no soap, no towels for the kitchen area, no phone in the room, and no drawer space for clothes. The dead bolt on the door wouldn't work with the key and the door looked like it had recently been broken in to or the like. The ice machine didn't work during our entire trip and people with large vehicles didn't follow the posted parking procedure of parking facing in, which made for issues in the parking lots, because management didn't enforce the posted regulations. We had to ask for towels the first 2 days (finally receiving enought for the remainder of our stay) and take out our own garbage because the housekeeping didn't check the door hanger and note we left. The refrigerator was difficult to regulate. We sprayed the room with disinfectant daily and kept our food and belongs bagged. They have a posted policy of no refunds after checkin, so you are stuck unless you request seeing your accomodations prior to paying/checking in, which I wish we would have done. My family and I having been coming to Ocean City for many years and have never been so disappointed or treated so poorly. We were grossly mislead by the Islander's website and the employees with which we spoke prior to arrival. The Islander is not worth $1100+ for 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and wow is it a dump”
Reviews.Author: hoterwah00
Reviews.Content: ok it was a last minute reservationand i was low on funds. so i searched around and found the islander...it was cheap and avail last minute in august ....however it was a total dump chipping paint bad pannelling smelly room bad a/c and just run down dirty. it was a bad place to stay .the doors to the rooms had way old eys ...think gas station bathroom. the place was just what i guess i paid for in ocean city md. a cheap dump please save more money and stay in a better place or change your dates but do not stay here . i will enclose a few pick of the nathroom floor,which was cracked, dirty and by the way lealed to the floor blow us ...oops the walls in the bathroom were painted plywood no covering at all gross...there was nomicrowave like my reservations said and the manager was not very fluent in english. he semed friendly but just not helpful if this is the best 165 a night can get you in o.c. don't go live and learn but don't stay here unless ya like the distinct experience of living in a housing project ...

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresentation”
Reviews.Author: Macsrabbit
Reviews.Content: This hotel web site is very deceiving. The web site makes it look like a palace. It is actually a DUMP. The place is very dated, which is ok if the dated amenities function properly. This is not the case at the Islander. The rooms were cleaned with some type of industrial strength cleaner that smells worse that the mildew and dampness that it is meant to cover. The room was dirty. We actually purchased cleaner and Lysol and cleaned ourselves. The desk clerk boasted that the room was recently remodeled. The carpet was stained in several places, the kitchenette was built with wood veneer cabinets circa 1975, the fridge was old and didn't work well. The wood paneled walls are vintage 1965. The room door lock had evidently been tampered with and did not work properly. The door lock would stick and the key did not fit properly. The dead bolt simply did not work. The room key did not fit the lock. The ice machine did not work. We reported this to the office staff and they responded that they knew, but did nothing t fix it in seven days. We requested towels, bath mats, hand soap, etc. twice. All we got were excuses from the staff. I finally followed one of the staff to the laundry and got towels. The next day, I had to request towels again. They finally responded with a weeks worth of towels. This was the third day of a seven day stay. All of this only cost us an average of $138 per night. This adds up to one big WARNING. These people are liars. They are rude and do not accomodate their guests. They merely take your cash and ignore your requests. As an OC regular, I will make every effort to send people across the street to one of the numerous other facilities on the block. STAY AWAY FROM THE ISLANDER.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Islander”
Reviews.Author: ze1okorussian
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying at the Islander. The motel has a nice atmosphere to it which made my stay that much more relaxing. It is minutes away from the beach and everything else you may need to enjoy your vacation to full potential. Had a great time. Looking forward to coming here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe if you aren't rich, but don't bring your kids”
Reviews.Author: NeesasMom
Reviews.Content: Well, this was the second time I stayed at the Islander. My family has been taking a vacation to Ocean City for years now. We booked 3 rooms. All of the rooms had a mildew smell from wet carpet, and my aunt's room's AC didn't work. When she asked for someone to come and fix it, it took 5 hours, and it was 98 degrees outside. We had to buy Lysol to spray the carpets and cleaned the bathrooms ourselves. When we got home, all of our clothes and bags smelled like the room! The only good side to this place is location. We were 2 blocks from the beach and in walking distance to food.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Islander Motel”
Reviews.Author: chrystal86
Reviews.Content: Me and a few of my friends were planning a trip to Ocean City in 2004 since we were graduating. I searched the Web for a few weeks and found the Islander Motel. I printed out the pictures and all details, and we all decided on that one. It is only 2 blocks from the beach, which is amazing! It has great service and the security guard was so nice and checked in with us every night because there was a lot of rowdy people around. Only thing- it didn't have a clock/alarm clock. My boyfriend and I are planning to go to Ocean City this year (he has never been to a beach!) and I definetly filled him in about the Islander Motel. If we get to go, that is where we will be staying. I loved it and its great service!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: Adul
Reviews.Content: Great vacation! Great price! The Motel was very good. We had a great time. Our room was very clean and service was perfect. We stayed 6 days and had a Great Vacation. Highly recommended this Motel for people who have children. Lyudmila

Reviews.Title: “Bad, Bad, Bad”
Reviews.Author: dallist
Reviews.Content: tblivenlief and I stayed there at the same time. We were there from 8/21-8/25. This hotel is dirty, rundown and dark. I guess they make it dark so we don't see the dirt and grim everywhere. It had old wood paneling, old dirty carpeting and the bathroom was mint green and white, this hotel is right out of a 70's horror movie, lol. I also attempted to ask for my money back and again "no refunds." The front desk people were nice but not nice enough where they wanted to give me my money back. Oh There are no phones in the rooms! I found that to be odd. My daughter one night was walking in the room barefooted and when I asked her to show me her feet they were BLACK!! We walked in the rooms the whole time with our flip flops on. Good thing I brought my own sheets and pillow cases. But! we were there, we weren't getting our money back so we had to make the best of it. The location is great, food, entertainment and fun is everywhere. The boardwalk is about 1 1/2 blks. from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tblivenlife
Reviews.Content: This was an aweful experience. I paid for the room and took one step in the room and realized how horrible it was and asked for my money back and the owner indicated "sorry there are no refunds". It was extremely rundown and they tried to cover up the crud by using an extremely strong cleaning solution that lingered in the room and burned our eyes the entire time. the customer service was terrible. all of the guest staying in the other rooms had the same experience. Please if you go to this hotel you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: Travelers77
Reviews.Content: We are use to staying in older family run establishments and are not normally concerned about about older furnishings. As well as we are regulars to Ocean City and can definitely tell you there are alot better accommodations than the Islander. This was the worst experience we ever encountered. Problems were: 1) Overbooked our room and sent us (two couples) to a two bedroom Apt the first night. 2) Did not offer to move us back to the hotel the next day. We had to waste our vacation time doing it ourselves. 3) We were to have a pool side room. Instead they put us in the blighted section of their establishment which happens to be bayside. 4) Our rooms were extremely dark and dingy. Lights did not all work. Were actually falling apart. 5) Did not service our room after the first nights stay. Actually never serviced it while we were there. When we asked for towels they asked us to bring down the old ones. There were many people having numerous problems. People were being shuffled around between rooms. Overbooking is one thing but not servicing your customers is unacceptable. We talked to about five different groups of people that were all having problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best Motel and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: MightyNick
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends were looking for a nice motel by the beach. At first I was scared after reading a couple negative reviews, but we decided we'd give it a shot for three days - we ended up staying a whole week! The Islander was what we had wanted! Although it is an old motel, the room was nice and clean. We actually saved money on food by cooking ourselves. We never had to complain about towels or bed sheets. Nice personnel and very polite owners. This Motel was run by a friendly, obliging family. It was very enjoyable stay. Will definately recommend it to the rest of my friends that didnt go. Nick

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: dresq1027
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why other people had a bad time. The Islander is located at 21st. street across from Phillips. We were there for 9 days and enjoyed every one of them. Sure the kids were rowdy, but it's the beach and is to be expected. The staff went out of their way for me and my family. They were an exceptional group of people. The pool is small, as are the rooms, but again, it's the beach. Location was prime, bay is two blocks behind you and the ocean isone block in front of you. My wife and I have been looking for a place to stay every year, and I think we've found it at the Islander. One additional note, they have small stoves with no ovens and a small fridge...be prepared and bring a cooler to save space.

Reviews.Title: “Down Hill Property”
Reviews.Author: ak629
Reviews.Content: This property was sold in 2005 and had been previosly owned operated by a local family. After the change in ownership we arrived to old tires, a/c units and gang grafitti spray painted on the exterior walls at the dock area. Over flowing garbage cans and litter in the parking lots were a daily observation during our 2 week stay. Management blammed the lack of staffing but workers were observed hanging out at pool area and not tending to the property. I was in disbelief that this motel went from an A++ condition to a run down hole in the wall in less then one year. Unless something has changed in 2007 I would recomend taking your $130 a night fee and spending it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: snook3133
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on 21st street across from phillips crab house. It is close to the boardwalk also which I enjoyed. My biggest complaint is the security were intrusive. We are paying guests, not criminals. There was no warrant for their behavior. As for the property itself the pool and rooms are smaller then some luxury properties nearby. But for the price and location its not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Wrost ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arliner18
Reviews.Content: On this past Memorial weekend my boyfriend and I had reservations to stay in this Motel. I personally made the reservations in their "so called" website. to my surprise when we got there the two people at the front desk, which were having beer and socializing; very rudely told us they could not accomodate us. Truth is, they had booked all the rooms and did not check with their web-site provider. Their excuse "they are suppose to fax us your confirmation and they didn't" Like we are responsible for their inefficiency. They suggested us two nearby dirty and ugly motels, that later on i found out are owed by the same family that owns the islander. My boyfriend and I after a 71/2 drive had to go around ocean city looking for a decent place to stay. Fortunally we stop at the ocean mecca who happily accomodated us with a very clean room. Our stay there was the best. Personallyh i think they over book their most decent motel to get their nasty ones to get desperate people like us. Luckly we didn't fall in their trap:) I dont think they deserve to make business with anyone so if your looking for an affordable motel, clean, great location, great service, great pool stay at the ocean mecca:)

Reviews.Title: “highly not recommended”
Reviews.Author: picputt
Reviews.Content: We have been using this place for many years. Never again. Last year we went down over Labor Day to no electric. They charged us the full amount for the night and we had to go out and buy candles for light. We got out of two of the three nights we had booked. They never offered us any kind of apology or money back for the rotten stay. New owners have this for the past couple of years and maybe in their previous country these accomodations would be considered satisfactory but not here. We are done with them. We are hoping they lose their shirts.

Reviews.Title: “We're going back next year.”
Reviews.Author: G8tor
Reviews.Content: Owners were very gracious and concerned about our being happy with our accomodations. Motel is at a great locatiion to everything by walking or bus. Pool is beautiful and clean. Rooms are nice for the price. This is not the Hilton, don't expect it. We don't spend a lot of time in the room. Rooms were a 9 for cleanliness, always room for improvement wherever you stay and I've stayed at some really bad places. There was a mildew smell in our room which mellowed with the AC on and we didn't know the code on our confirmation for a King size bed and so we had two double beds both, neither a major issue for us and didn't have any effect on our stay. I check shower curtains and tub enclosure's for being clean first thing, curtain had no mildew and enclosure didn't have scum. Get your tv remote at check in and hang your service tag on your door if you want towels. We plan on going back again next year and we will have our King size bed. I can't say enough about how nice the owners were to us.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I did not enjoy my stay at The Islander in Ocean City, MD. The customer service is TERRIBLE. I left a bag in the room I was staying in and called the following day to inquire if it had been found. After telling me that there was no bag found in the room, the lady was not very nice and she said she'd check with the lady who cleaned the room and asked me to call the next day. When I called the next day she told me that still nothing was found. When I politely expressed my dissatisfaction she HANG UP ON ME!!!! And then when I called back she claimed that I hang up on her. She was not very nice and I would not recommend anyone staying there or dealing with these people.

Reviews.Title: “Islander Motel --do not send your students there for Senior Week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As parents of students who booked a room there for Senior Week, we were outraged that the owners were going to charge them $250.00 per room for having their next door neighbors(all registered quests at the hotel) in their room after 10:00pm. The students had the door ajar, no drinking, nothing illegal or loud ness was going on--they were strickly talking and getting to know each other. A man knocks on the door at 10:30 pm and tells the boys to leave, which they did. The next morning both rooms were told that they had to pay $250.00 each or be evicted or they were going to call the police for breaking their rule of "no quests after 10:00 pm in the rooms." They make the students sign a contract when they show up for the week with no prior knowledge to the parents or students of their rule. Our girls did not think they were doing anything wrong since the other kids were registered guests. Our outrage comes from the fact that the owners are trying to scarethese students into paying them $250.00 per room or fear being evicted. The owners are keeping the money.

HotelInfo.Name: The Islander Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 2001 Philadelphia Avenue, Ocean City, MD 21842
